title: Frequent "no bid received"
body:
#### Environment

We're rocking 2500 validators with..

```
Lighthouse: v2.5.1
mev-boost: v0.7.10
Network: prater
Relay: https://0xafa4c6985aa049fb79dd37010438cfebeb0f2bd42b115b89dd678dab0670c1de38da0c4e9138c9290a398ecd9a0b3110@builder-relay-goerli.flashbots.net
```

#### Issue
About 60% of the proposals fallback to local EE (the other 40% are successfully built via mev-boost).

When it happens, we see these errors in Lighthouse:

```
Aug 21 14:02:25.958 INFO Requesting blinded header from connected builder, parent_hash: ..., pubkey: ..., slot: Slot(...), service: exec
Aug 21 14:02:26.258 INFO No payload provided by connected builder. Attempting to propose through local execution engine, service: exec
```

And these errors in mev-boost:

```
time="2022-08-21T14:02:26Z" level=info msg="no bid received" method=getHeader module=service parentHash=0xdffccc7de563f586e027d563c7e5df860155d2c0aecc87f392aac8aece7e9fc4 pubkey=0x884fcee670d202053d48e64561d3f53f8478fa682f6f2a9676db082c8aa409e3b9fc6f132665d1f968758346a612c8cd slot=3715212
time="2022-08-21T14:02:26Z" level=info msg="http: GET /eth/v1/builder/header/3715212/0xdffccc7de563f586e027d563c7e5df860155d2c0aecc87f392aac8aece7e9fc4/0x884fcee670d202053d48e64561d3f53f8478fa682f6f2a9676db082c8aa409e3b9fc6f132665d1f968758346a612c8cd 204" duration=0.096443931 method=GET module=service path=/eth/v1/builder/header/3715212/0xdffccc7de563f586e027d563c7e5df860155d2c0aecc87f392aac8aece7e9fc4/0x884fcee670d202053d48e64561d3f53f8478fa682f6f2a9676db082c8aa409e3b9fc6f132665d1f968758346a612c8cd
```

#### Notes
- Reproduced on Sepolia with Flashbots' relay (2 weeks ago)
- We run a custom-built VC (instead of Lighthouse's), but correct me if I'm wrong, since VC isn't involved in the bidding flow, it's unlikely to be the culprit?

---

Does anyone else have this issue as frequently or at all? Thanks üôè
This is not an error, just that the relay doesn't have a block for these slots at the time you requested. I'm investigating the frequency
For the slot in your log we just had no bid/block available. Sometimes that's just the case. How often are you seeing no bids?

> How often are you seeing no bids?

Out of the last 19 proposals, 15 had no header available.

@metachris Do you think this issue might be caused by improper validator registrations?

We post registrations to Beacon nodes a bit differently ‚Äî each registration is sent every 12 seconds with the timestamp set to the time of the current epoch's first slot.

If the validator registration has been accepted by the relay at least once in the past, then this wouldn't be the issue.

I wonder though why do you do this way of validator registration? The standard way is to keep resending the last registration once per epoch, and only create a new registration once one of the preferences changes ü§î

> If the validator registration has been accepted by the relay at least once in the past, then this wouldn't be the issue.
> 
> I wonder though why do you do this way of validator registration? The standard way is to keep resending the last registration once per epoch, and only create a new registration once one of the preferences changes thinking

We blindly re-send `prepare_beacon_proposer` and `register_validator` every slot because Beacon nodes forget preparations after restarts (which we do often), but since registrations are kept in relays/builders, I realize now that this isn't necessary for `register_validator` üòÖ

Thanks for the tip üôè

Update: We've reduced the frequency of `register_validator` (so we don't spam our Beacon nodes anymore) and the problem seems to have gone away since. Now we see this error very rarely.

Unfortunately, we didn't test this on Prater yet, but Sepolia is doing much better, so I'm closing this issue for now.

If anyone sees this error, just comment and I'll re-open.

Update: this started happening again on both Sepolia & Prater.

I've gathered & organized proposals with their mev-boost/Lighthouse logs, in case you want to investigate this. @metachris

I am getting same issue on mainnet and goerli, also running lighthouse,  I do wonder if there just isn't any bid/block available or if it something else, will follow the issue just in case!
How often and under which circumstances are you calling getHeader? Our builders are only building for slots that have a registered validator.

> How often and under which circumstances are you calling getHeader? Our builders are only building for slots that have a registered validator.

I am using standard lighthouse architecture connected to mev-boost, the header is called when I am about to produce a block I believe and registration is done every 5 minutes ... my validators are ready as I can see on flashbots api, for example this one:
https://boost-relay.flashbots.net/relay/v1/data/validator_registration?pubkey=0x872d7cb9b61e4002a9f56cc8db4434924120ca7f1a58ee5661e745ed03d19c60a6d00c0f76f3e04b140f3b60f2b1a6ce

We use Lighthouse BN, so same as behavior as @PixelNoob.

However, we had a very big delay of 1-3 seconds between the slot time and until we requested the BN to produce a blinded block (which should call getHeader).

After we reduced the delay down to between 0.08s to 0.3s, this problem completely went away.

On the other hand, around the same time we've added 2 relays in addition to Flashbots (bloXroute and Blocknative), so this could've helped, but I doubt it.

@PixelNoob Can you check in mev-boost's logs -- when exactly did it first receive the getHeader call (path is `/eth/v1/builder/header/`) for that proposal where it said "no bid"? Can you share the log here with the timestamp & slot?

> On the other hand, around the same time we've added 2 relays in addition to Flashbots (bloXroute and Blocknative), so this could've helped, but I doubt it.

This did it for me, added bloXroute and Blocknative and we have then produced MEV blocks with other relays but not yet with flashbot, so now I am thinking is a flashbot relay issue and not MEV-BOOST software.

I will check logs and get back to you.
